books.author: George Orwell
books.summary: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother.

books.author: Harper Lee
books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.summary: A novel about racial injustice in the Deep South, seen through the eyes of a young girl.

books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.title: The Fellowship of the Ring
books.summary: The first part of an epic fantasy tale about the struggle to destroy the One Ring.

books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.summary: A story about the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with Daisy Buchanan.

books.author: Jane Austen
books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.summary: A classic romance novel exploring the manners and matrimonial machinations among the British gentry.

books.author: Herman Melville
books.title: Moby-Dick
books.summary: An epic tale of obsession and revenge, following Captain Ahab's quest to kill the white whale.

books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.title: War and Peace
books.summary: A historical novel that chronicles the lives of five aristocratic families during the Napoleonic Wars.

books.author: Mary Shelley
books.title: Frankenstein
books.summary: A gothic novel that tells the story of Victor Frankenstein and the monster he creates.

books.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
books.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
books.summary: A magical realist novel that tells the multi-generational story of the Buend√≠a family.

books.author: Miguel de Cervantes
books.title: Don Quixote
books.summary: A classic Spanish novel about a man who becomes a knight-errant to revive chivalry and sets out on whimsical adventures.

books.author: Homer
books.title: The Odyssey
books.summary: An ancient Greek epic poem that follows Odysseus' ten-year journey home after the Trojan War.
